trans-unit.source: Provides a framework for <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel"></xref> elements that virtualize their child data collection.
This is an abstract class.

In this context, "virtualize" refers to a technique by which a subset of [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)] elements are generated from a larger number of data items based on which items are visible on the screen.

It is intensive, both in terms of memory and processor, to generate a large number of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] elements when only a few may be on the screen at a given time.

A panel that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel>, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel>, calculates visible items and works with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerGenerator> from an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> (such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListView>) to only create [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] elements for visible items.
The following lists describes cases when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel> cannot virtualize item containers:
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> contains item containers of different types.
For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Menu> might have items that use both <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Separator> objects as the item containers.
You explicitly create the item containers to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>.
For more information about explicitly versus implicitly creating item containers, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> class.

When a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel> is virtualizing item containers, you may need to save state information that is associated with a container instead of with the data item itself.

For example, if an item is contained by an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Expander> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Expander.IsExpanded%2A> state is bound to the item container, and not to the data item itself.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Expander> is reused for a new item, the current value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Expander.IsExpanded%2A> is used for the new item.
In addition, the old item does not retain its <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Expander.IsExpanded%2A> value.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> class.

Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel.InternalChildren"></xref> collection of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> element.

This method offers better performance for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel> elements that virtualize their child collection than does the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.UIElementCollection.Add%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> child to add to the collection.
When implemented in a derived class, generates the item at the specified index location and makes it visible.
The index position of the item that is generated and made visible.
Generates the item at the specified index location and makes it visible.
The index position of the item that is generated and made visible.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLength"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLengthUnit"></xref> attached property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> can virtualize items that are grouped or organized in a hierarchy.
This method calls <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CanHierarchicallyScrollAndVirtualizeCore%2A>.
A value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> can virtualize items that are grouped or organized in a hierarchy.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> can virtualize items that are grouped or organized in a hierarchy.
Classes that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel> and support virtualizing items that are grouped or organized in a hierarchy should override this method to return `true`.
`false` in all cases.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLength"></xref> property.
The element to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLength"></xref> attached property from.
The size of the cache before and after the viewport when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> is virtualizing.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLengthUnit"></xref> property.
The default is of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLengthUnit%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizationCacheLengthUnit.Page>.
The element to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLengthUnit"></xref> attached property from.
The type of unit that is used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLength"></xref> property.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsContainerVirtualizable"></xref> property.
The default is of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsContainerVirtualizable%2A> attached property `true`.
The element to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsContainerVirtualizable"></xref> attached property from.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> should virtualize an item; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsVirtualizing"></xref> attached property.
The default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsVirtualizing%2A> property is `true`.
The object from which the attached property value is read.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> is virtualizing its content; otherwise `false`.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsVirtualizingWhenGrouping"></xref> property.
The default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsVirtualizingWhenGrouping%2A> property is `false`.
The element to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsVirtualizingWhenGrouping"></xref> attached property from.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> virtualizes the grouped items in its collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the position of the specified item, relative to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>.
This method calls <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.GetItemOffsetCore%2A>.
The element whose position to find.
The position of the specified item, relative to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>.
Returns the position of the specified item, relative to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>.
Classes that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel> should override this method to return the position `child`, relative to the panel.
The element whose position to find.
0 in all cases.
Gets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.ScrollUnit"></xref> property.
The default value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.ScrollUnit%2A> property is <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ScrollUnit.Item>.
The element to get the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.ScrollUnit"></xref> attached property from.
A value that indicates whether scrolling is measured as items in the collection or as pixels.
Returns the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.VirtualizationMode"></xref> attached property for the specified object.
The object from which the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.VirtualizationMode"></xref> property is read.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether the object uses container recycling.

Adds the specified <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel.InternalChildren"></xref> collection of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> element at the specified index position.

This method offers better performance for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel> elements that virtualize their child collection than does the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.UIElementCollection.Add%2A> method.
The index position within the collection at which the child element is inserted.
The <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement"></xref> child to add to the collection.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsContainerVirtualizable"></xref> attached property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsVirtualizing"></xref> dependency property.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsVirtualizingWhenGrouping"></xref> attached property.
Gets a value that identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerGenerator"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerGenerator"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>.
Called when the collection of child elements is cleared by the base <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel"></xref> class.

Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items"></xref> collection that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel"></xref> changes.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that raised the event.
Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerGenerator.ItemsChanged"></xref> event.
Removes child elements from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Panel.InternalChildren"></xref> collection.

This method offers better performance for <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Panel> elements that virtualize their child collection than does the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.UIElementCollection.RemoveRange%2A> method.
The beginning index position within the collection at which the first child element is removed.
The total number of child elements to remove from the collection.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.ScrollUnit"></xref> attached property.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLength"></xref> attached property.
The cache is the amount of space above or below the viewport in which items are not virtualized.
Use a cache to avoid generating [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] elements as they’re scrolled into view.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLengthUnit%2A> property determines the unit of measurement that is used by <xref:System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLength%2A>.
The object to set the property on.
The size of the cache before and after the viewport when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> is virtualizing.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLengthUnit"></xref> attached property.
The object to set the property on.
The type of unit that is used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.CacheLength"></xref> property.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsContainerVirtualizable"></xref> attached property.
The object to set the property on.
`true` to indicate that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> should virtualize an item; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel.IsVirtualizingProperty"></xref> attached property.
The object to which the attached property value is set.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingStackPanel"></xref> is virtualizing; otherwise `false`.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.IsVirtualizingWhenGrouping"></xref> attached property.
The object to set the property on.
`true` to specify that the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref> virtualizes the grouped items in its collection; otherwise, `false`.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.ScrollUnit"></xref> attached property.
The object to set the property on.
A value that indicates whether scrolling is measured as items in the collection or as pixels.
Sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.VirtualizationMode"></xref> attached property on the specified object.
The element on which to set the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.VirtualizationMode"></xref> property.
One of the enumeration values that specifies whether element uses container recycling.
Returns a value that indicates whether a changed item in an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> affects the layout for this panel.

`true` if the changed item is a direct child of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>; `false` if the changed item is an indirect descendant of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>.
Contains data regarding the changed item.
`true` if the changed item in an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> affects the layout for this panel; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value that indicates whether a changed item in an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> affects the layout for this panel.

`true` if the changed item is a direct child of this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>; `false` if the changed item is an indirect descendant of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel"></xref>.
Contains data regarding the changed item.
`true` if the changed item in an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl"></xref> affects the layout for this panel; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.VirtualizingPanel.VirtualizationMode"></xref> dependency property.
